channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-1317] Zookeeper master won't start when starting a new hbase instance in local mode
item.description:
When staring a new "cluster" in local mode I get the following warning, that keeps repeating itself:

2009-04-08 11:08:48,695 WARN org.apache.hadoop.hbase.zookeeper.ZooKeeperWrapper: Failed to create /hbase:
org.apache.zookeeper.KeeperException$ConnectionLossException: KeeperErrorCode = ConnectionLoss for /hbase
at org.apache.zookeeper.KeeperException.create(KeeperException.java:90)
at org.apache.zookeeper.KeeperException.create(KeeperException.java:42)
at org.apache.zookeeper.ZooKeeper.create(ZooKeeper.java:518)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.zookeeper.ZooKeeperWrapper.ensureExists(ZooKeeperWrapper.java:253)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.zookeeper.ZooKeeperWrapper.ensureParentExists(ZooKeeperWrapper.java:274)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.zookeeper.ZooKeeperWrapper.writeMasterAddress(ZooKeeperWrapper.java:362)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.HMaster.writeAddressToZooKeeper(HMaster.java:259)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.HMaster.<init>(HMaster.java:249)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.LocalHBaseCluster.<init>(LocalHBaseCluster.java:95)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.LocalHBaseCluster.<init>(LocalHBaseCluster.java:78)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.HMaster.doMain(HMaster.java:1029)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.HMaster.main(HMaster.java:1070)
item.summary: Zookeeper master won't start when starting a new hbase instance in local mode

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
ulimit -n 1024
2009-04-08 12:00:01,103 INFO org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.HMaster: vmName=OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM, vmVendor=Sun Microsystems Inc., vmVersion=1.6.0-b09
2009-04-08 12:00:01,104 INFO org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.HMaster: vmInputArguments=[-Xmx1000m, -XX:+HeapDumpOnOutOfMemoryError, -Dhbase.log.dir=/home/erik/src/newHBase/bin/../l
ogs, -Dhbase.log.file=hbase-erik-master-erik.streamy.com.log, -Dhbase.home.dir=/home/erik/src/newHBase/bin/.., -Dhbase.id.str=erik, -Dhbase.root.logger=INFO,DRFA, -Djava.library.p
ath=/home/erik/src/newHBase/bin/../lib/native/Linux-amd64-64]
2009-04-08 12:00:01,210 INFO org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.HMaster: My address is localhost:60000
2009-04-08 12:00:01,301 INFO org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.HMaster: Root region dir: file:/tmp/hbase-erik/hbase/-ROOT-/70236052
2009-04-08 12:00:01,339 INFO org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.HBaseRpcMetrics: Initializing RPC Metrics with hostName=HMaster, port=60000
2009-04-08 12:00:01,415 INFO org.apache.hadoop.hbase.zookeeper.ZooKeeperWrapper: Quorum servers: localhost:2181
2009-04-08 12:00:03,185 WARN org.apache.hadoop.hbase.zookeeper.ZooKeeperWrapper: Failed to create /hbase:
org.apache.zookeeper.KeeperException$ConnectionLossException: KeeperErrorCode = ConnectionLoss for /hbase
at org.apache.zookeeper.KeeperException.create(KeeperException.java:90)
at org.apache.zookeeper.KeeperException.create(KeeperException.java:42)
at org.apache.zookeeper.ZooKeeper.create(ZooKeeper.java:518)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.zookeeper.ZooKeeperWrapper.ensureExists(ZooKeeperWrapper.java:253)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.zookeeper.ZooKeeperWrapper.ensureParentExists(ZooKeeperWrapper.java:274)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.zookeeper.ZooKeeperWrapper.writeMasterAddress(ZooKeeperWrapper.java:362)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.HMaster.writeAddressToZooKeeper(HMaster.java:259)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.HMaster.<init>(HMaster.java:249)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.LocalHBaseCluster.<init>(LocalHBaseCluster.java:95)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.LocalHBaseCluster.<init>(LocalHBaseCluster.java:78)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.HMaster.doMain(HMaster.java:1029)
at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.HMaster.main(HMaster.java:1070)
Issue solved by updating to the latest code, seems like I had some older code when merging mine and Stack's code, so my old code with that caused this error had already been fixed.
